hero.title: Where Art
hero.subtitle: Exploring the fluid beauty of Turkish Ebru marbling and the geometric precision of modern photography

philosophy.title: Dual Perspectives
philosophy.description: Art is a conversation between tradition and innovation. Through the ancient technique of Ebru marbling and the contemporary lens of photography, I explore the boundaries of visual storytelling—where fluid organic forms dance with geometric precision, and each piece becomes a meditation on duality.
philosophy.ebruDesc: The ancient Turkish art of water marbling, where pigments float on liquid surfaces to create mesmerizing organic patterns—each piece unique, unrepeatable, alive.
philosophy.photoDesc: Capturing moments through a minimalist lens—finding beauty in structure, light, and shadow. Every frame is a deliberate composition of geometry and emotion.

about.title: About the Artist
about.intro: I am an artist who bridges worlds—the ancient and the contemporary, the fluid and the structured, the organic and the geometric.
about.para1: Through the centuries-old Turkish art of Ebru marbling, I explore the unpredictable beauty of water and pigment. Each piece is a meditation on impermanence and the acceptance of what emerges from chaos.
about.para2: My photography practice complements this fluidity with deliberate composition—finding poetry in architecture, light, and negative space. Where Ebru embraces spontaneity, photography demands intention. Together, they form a dialogue about control and surrender.
about.para3: Based between tradition and innovation, I create work that invites contemplation and celebrates the duality of the creative process.
about.quote: Art is not about perfection—it's about presence. It's about showing up to the blank page, the still water, the empty frame, and trusting what wants to emerge.
